title: Preparation Checklist
progressMessageHigh: You're nearly disaster ready! Great work!
progressMessageMedium: You're on track to becoming disaster ready!
actionButtonSubtitle: {{completedItems}} of {{totalItems}} items completed. Every step counts!

water.title: Secure Drinking Water
water.description: Store at least 1 gallon per person per day for 3 days.

food.title: Gather Non-Perishable Food
food.description: Include non-cook items and a manual can opener.

kit.title: Assemble First Aid Kit
kit.description: Include bandages, antiseptic, wipes, and essential medications.

flashlight.title: Pack Flashlight & Batteries
flashlight.description: Ensure fresh batteries and a spare set.

whistle.title: Carry a Whistle
whistle.description: For signaling help in an emergency.

cash.title: Store Emergency Cash
cash.description: Keep small bills and coins for emergencies.

goBags.title: Prepare Go-Bags
goBags.description: Personal kits with essentials for 3 days.

routes.title: Plan Evacuation Routes
routes.description: Identify multiple routes from home and work.

drills.title: Practice Evacuation Drills
drills.description: Run through your plan with family members.

contacts.title: Compile Emergency Contacts
contacts.description: Include family, doctors, and out-of-state contacts.

radio.title: Obtain NOAA Weather Radio
radio.description: With tone alert and extra batteries.

chargers.title: Secure Portable Chargers
chargers.description: For phones and other essential electronics.

groupChat.title: Set Up Group Communication
groupChat.description: Create family group chat or communication plan.

woundCare.title: Practice Wound Care
woundCare.description: Learn to clean and dress wounds properly.

response.title: Study Emergency Response
response.description: Know how to respond to common emergencies.

ui.chooseTopicSubtitle: Test your knowledge across different safety areas
ui.freeTrialText: 🎯 Try your first quiz without logging in! Sign up to unlock all topics.
ui.unlockDescription: Get access to all safety topics, track your progress, and earn achievements!
ui.resultLearningCompleteDescription: You've reviewed all the correct answers for this topic.

q1.question: What is the primary purpose of a "Go-Bag" or "Bug-Out Bag" in disaster preparedness?
options: To store non-perishable food for long-term survival.
To provide essential supplies for the first 72 hours during an evacuation.
To keep important documents safe during an emergency.
To carry tools for repairing damaged infrastructure.

q2.question: During an earthquake, what is the safest action to take?

q3.question: How much water should you store per person per day for emergency preparedness?

q4.question: What should you do if caught in a flash flood while driving?
options: Turn around and find an alternate route
Stay in the car and wait

q5.question: In case of a fire emergency, what is the most important rule?
options: Stay low and crawl under smoke

first-aid.title: First Aid Basics
first-aid.description: Life-saving first aid techniques and procedures

q1.question: What is the correct ratio of chest compressions to rescue breaths in adult CPR?

q2.question: How should you treat a severe bleeding wound?
options: Apply direct pressure and elevate if possible
Clean the wound with alcohol first

q3.question: What is the first step in treating someone who is choking but still conscious?
options: Give back blows between the shoulder blades

q4.question: How should you treat a burn from hot liquid?
options: Apply ice directly to the burn
Use butter or oil on the burn
Cool with cold running water for 10-20 minutes

q5.question: What should you do if someone is having a seizure?
options: Hold them down to prevent movement
Put something in their mouth to prevent tongue biting
Time the seizure and keep them safe from injury
Give them water to prevent dehydration

fire-safety.title: Fire Safety
fire-safety.description: Prevention and response to fire emergencies

q1.question: How often should you test smoke alarm batteries?

q2.question: What type of fire extinguisher should be used on electrical fires?

q3.question: If your clothes catch fire, what should you do?
options: Use water to put it out

q4.question: What is the recommended evacuation time for a typical house fire?

q5.question: Before opening a door during a fire, you should:
options: Open it quickly to check for fire
Feel the door handle and door for heat
Call out to see if anyone responds
Look for smoke under the door only

severe-weather.title: Severe Weather
severe-weather.description: Staying safe during extreme weather conditions

q1.question: During a tornado warning, where is the safest place to shelter?
options: Near windows to watch for the tornado
Lowest floor, interior room, away from windows
In a vehicle driving away from the tornado

q2.question: What wind speed defines a hurricane as Category 1?

q3.question: If caught outside during a lightning storm, you should:
options: Crouch low with feet together, avoiding metal objects
Keep moving to avoid being a target

q4.question: What is the most dangerous aspect of a hurricane?

q5.question: How much advance warning do tornado watches typically provide?

home-security.title: Home Security
home-security.description: Protecting your home and family from threats

q1.question: What is the most effective way to secure sliding glass doors?
options: Install a security bar in the track
Place a chair against the door

q2.question: When should you change your locks?
options: After moving to a new home

q3.question: What should you do if you think someone is trying to break into your home?
options: Call emergency services and stay in a secure room

q4.question: How can you make your home appear occupied while away?
options: Use timers for lights and consider a house sitter
Park a car in the driveway

q5.question: What information should you never give to strangers at your door?
options: Whether you're home alone or family schedule

travel-safety.title: Travel Safety
travel-safety.description: Staying safe while traveling and in unfamiliar places

q1.question: What should you do before traveling to a new country?
options: Research local laws, customs, and safety conditions

q2.question: How should you carry important documents while traveling?
options: Keep originals with you at all times
Leave them in your hotel room
Make copies and store originals separately

q3.question: If you feel you're being followed while traveling, you should:
options: Go to a crowded, well-lit public place

q4.question: What's the safest way to use ATMs while traveling?
options: Use ATMs inside banks or hotels when possible
Carry large amounts of cash instead

q5.question: When using public Wi-Fi while traveling, you should:
options: Avoid sensitive transactions and use a VPN if possible
Share the connection with other travelers

2.description: Tips to stay cool and safe in extreme heat.
